Creating a Requirement or Child Requirement

Creating a hierarchy of requirements allows you to organize a project more efficiently and work toward agreed-upon goals.

To create a requirement:

  1. Click the Requirement tab on the upper pane.

  2. From the Requirement menu or context menu, do one of the following:

    • Click New to create a new requirement that is not the child of an existing requirement.

    • Click New Child Requirement to create a new requirement that is the child of an existing requirement.

    The New Requirement dialog appears.

  3. On the Requirement tab of the New Requirement dialog:

    1. Enter a name for the requirement.

    2. Select an owner (i.e., the person ultimately responsible for the fulfillment of the requirement) from the Owner drop-down list box.

    3. (Optional) Provide an external source or reference for the requirement in the External Reference text box. If you are importing requirements from CaliberRM, this field displays CaliberRM identification for this requirement.

    4. Enter the initial description of this requirement. This description is usually revised over time to eliminate ambiguities.

  4. On the Responsibilities tab, list the team members responsible for this requirement. If notification is enabled, these people will be notified about changes made to any field in the requirement. made to it.

    1. Click Add to display the Select Responsible Users dialog.

    2. Double-click the name of each person to be added to the list. When you double-click the name, it moves from the Users list box to the Responsible list box.

    3. When all the responsible users have been added to the Responsible list box, click OK.

  5. Ignore the Ambiguities tab for the time being. Later reviewers will use this tab to locate ambiguities in the initial description and revise that description.

  6. Use the Estimate tab to indicate the best-case and worst-case times for fulfilling this requirement. The entries are usually in staff days.

    1. Enter the number of units (usually days) estimated for the fulfillment of this requirement in the Expected text box.

    2. Enter the number of units (usually days) estimated for the worst-case fulfillment of this requirement in the High Effort text box.

    3. Enter the number of units (usually days) estimated for the best-case fulfillment of this requirement in the Low Effort text box.

    4. Add any appropriate notes in the Notes text box.

  7. Use the Custom tab to provide values for any custom requirement properties that your team leader or company may have created. See the StarTeam Administrator’s Guide for information about creating custom fields. To change the default property:

    1. Double-click the name of the custom property. The Edit Property dialog appears.

    2. Select a new value for this property. For integer, text, and real fields, Value is a text box. For enumerated types and user IDs, it is a list box. For dates and times, Value has a date check box and a time check box, each of which is followed by a date or time in the format for your locale.

    3. Repeat steps a and b for other custom properties.

  8. (Optional) Use the Attachments tab to add additional files to this requirement.

    1. Click Add if you want to attach a file. The Open dialog appears.

    2. From the Open dialog, select the files to be attached.

    3. Click Open.

    4. Repeat steps a-c for additional attachments.

  9. Use the Comment tab to explain why the requirement is being created. Enter your reasons in the Comment for new revision text box.

  10. Click OK to save the requirement.
